author: mrmitch
title: Trike for under two dollars - go LEGO go !
review: I didn't have any trike motorcycles at the time I saw this one so I got two. I like the medic and the three wheeler is cool-period. One stays at home in my LEGO collection and the other sits on my desk at the Insurance office. When kids come in with their parents they like to play with it, some of our monthly customers kid's call me legoman(its funny). I also have a few of the extra older LEGO catalogs in my desk to keep them busy while the adults take care of business. This little set is special to me for the reasons I just mentioned.

author: hustla187
title: Just a Trike
review: This is one of the trike vehicles Lego used to make. If you never owned one, it would be good to pick up one. However, you also get a minifig and some supplies and that is pretty much it. This is great for the fan that never owned a trike, but that's pretty much it.

author: Quirrelthesquirrel
title: Neat pieces
review: I got this set for $3.00 AUD at an old toy store back in 2007. I am happy that LEGO made a 3-wheeled motorbike because they're cool. This set has cool pieces like the black suitcase and the bike. This set is fun to play with. The only bad thing is the suitcase is easy to lose!

author: Adventurers
title: An awesome set
review: I still remember the day I got this set, Christmas 2001, along with the shell car wash set and some other small shell sets. Boy, was I thrilled. But enough about me, lets talk about the set itself. Although small, it has great potential and will look cool in just about any town layout. The only problem I see with this set is that...well it's......I can't think of any cons! Great minifig, great accessories, and awesome concept, you get gas, and your kids get a dirt cheap toy for less than a candy bar! Seriously, at $1.70, this set is well worth the price no matter who you are. If you can find it for less than $5.00, buy it!
